result.execSummary:
All charges against Shawn R. Otterson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawn R. Otterson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn R. Otterson

records.addlTxt:
9:10 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Shawn R. Otterson in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Shawn R. Otterson.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard on agreement. 
22CF46 6 months jail - 14 days to be served w/out EM. Dismiss bail jump charge in 22CF51
Attorney Steiner confirms agreement. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a no contest plea. Court accepts the defendants no contest plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

Atty Steiner moves to dismiss 22CF51. Court dismisses 22CF51. 

22CF46
Ct 1 - 961.42(1) - Maintain Drug Trafficking Place (No Contest) 

22CF51
Ct 1 - 946.49(1)(b) - Bail Jumping-Felony (DISMISSED)

Atty Steiner comments on sentencing -  recommends as to 22CF46: 6 months jail - 14 days to be served w/out EM.
Atty Zaleski comments on sentencing. 17 days jail credit. 

Defendant comments. 

Court orders: 6 months jail -  first 14 days to be served w/out electronic monitoring. Stay for defendants job interviews to be completed. Allow to report no later than October 14th at 6:30 PM. May serve sentence in another county.  Huber approved if employed. Court costs, total of $518.00. Bond in both cases to be applied to cover costs.  Any remaining bond money to be returned. Jail credit - will be confirmed with jail.

The court does not have a complete address for Mr. Otterson in the file and the mail has been returned as Undeliverable.  I reached out to Atty Zaleski and he provided an email address for his client.  I emailed both Notice of Hearings to Mr. Otterson on 8/17/22 and asked that he provide an address to the court. *hb

     Atty. Zaleski states had spoken to the D.A. about a counter offer, but needs to speak to his client; believes is close to resolving; asks for one more status.
     Court concludes at 2:35 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

22CF46 & 22CF51

Atty Zalenski is heard, defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing.

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings.
Information brought over 11:36 am 

Atty Zaleski waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count in each case 22CF46 & 22CF51

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.

Hearing on April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:21 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Shawn Robert Otterson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22GF74 also heard is 22CF46 - Failure to appear on March 23rd. 

DA requests a total of $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall appear for scheduled court dates.

Defendant is heard. 

22CF46 Court will order an additional $250.00 cash bond for failure to appear. Conditions remain the same. 

22GF74 Court orders a $250.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant will submit to a UA prior to being released from jail.
Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
